review: For all the people with HULU stuttering issues, the problem is with the stock power adapter. I was able to resolve the issue with both of my fire tv stick's by plugging the power into my XBOX's. It also worked with an standard iphone USB adapter. Not sure if Amazon went cheap on the power blocks or if they are purposely filtering down the 5volts, possibly to extend the life of the device or prevent overheating but it comes at the expense of the sticks performance. I love the firetv stick and would suggest it to anyone.

review: The first time I installed it on my 7 year old Sony 52" TV it worked great. Then I took it upstairs to the TV in the kitchen so my wife could enjoy it and it worked great. When I took it back down to the Sony it no longer worked. All I could get is a blue screen with a message that said something like, " access was denied". I tried resetting to factory defaults but still got the same message. Next I contacted customer support and spoke to a tech who had me try the same things I had already done and then said he could not help me and would transfer me to another tech. This guy had me try all the things we had already tried with several more like disconnecting all my inputs to the TV except for the Fire Stick; but nothing worked. Finally he just told me the fire Stick was not compatible with my Sony. So of course, I asked him why it worked the first time I used it and was able to watch a movie on Prime without a problem. He had no answer except that the TV is not compatible with the Fire Stick. I tried searching for an Amazon web page that would give me a list of TV's that are or are not compatible with the fire Stick and could not find anything. It seems to me that if the Fire Stick is not compatible with all TV's that Amazon would let people know before the purchased the Sony TV. Now I've got a Fire Stick that doesn't work on my main TV and a year of Prime that I can't make full usage of. I feel like I've been ripped of by Amazon.
